intro: Ambrina obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf ambrina, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its obovate leaves, which are broad at the tip and taper towards the base. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ambrina obovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
